AHMC - Catalano FamilyCollection processed by Larry WeimerNew-York Historical SocietyNew-York Historical Society170 Central Park WestNew York, NY 10024(212) 873-3400This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2022-04-28T12:26:55Finding aid written in EnglishDescribing Archives: A Content Standard The documents in the collection are in English.
New-York Historical Society
Catalano family certificates AHMC - Catalano Family
4 item(s) in 1 folder
1910-1937 Four documents: Certificate of citizenship (1932) for immigrant from Italy, Charles Catalano of Brooklyn, N.Y. (grandfather of the donor), with photograph; Hospital birth certificate from Madison Park Hospital (1934) for Charles Catalano, Jr. (father of the donor), with footprints; Certificate of naturalization (1910) for immigrant from Italy, Giuseppe Di Stefano of Brooklyn, N.Y. (the donor's paternal grandmother's father); and a diphtheria protection certificate from the New York State Department of Health (1937) for Rose Marie Di Blasio, (the donor's mother).
To request this material for research, and for fuller information about it, please follow this link to the record in N-YHS's catalog, Bobcat: Catalano Family Certificates
